TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit DictionaryEntry extends System.ValueType

Docs.summary: Defines a dictionary key/value pair that can be set or retrieved.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Collections.IDictionaryEnumerator.Entry%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method returns an instance of this type.
The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in Visual C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) requires the type of each element in the collection. Since each element of the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> is a key/value pair, the element type is not the type of the key or the type of the value. Instead, the element type is DictionaryEntry. For example:
[!code-cpp[System.Collections.DictionaryEntry#01](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.collections.dic_0_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.DictionaryEntry#01](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.collections.dic_0_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Collections.DictionaryEntry#01](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.collections.dic_0_1.cs)]
The `foreach` statement is a wrapper around the enumerator, which only allows reading from, not writing to, the collection.
## Examples The following example demonstrates the use of DictionaryEntry to iterate through a <xref:System.Collections.Hashtable> object.
[!code-cpp[System.Collections.DictionaryEntry#00](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.collections.dic_0_2.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.DictionaryEntry#00](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.collections.dic_0_2.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Collections.DictionaryEntry#00](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.collections.dic_0_2.cs)]

Docs.param: The object defined in each key/value pair.
Docs.summary: Initializes an instance of the type with the specified key and value.
Docs.exception: is and the .NET Framework version is 1.0 or 1.1.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the key in the key/value pair.
Docs.value: The key in the key/value pair.
